@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A simple message bus singleton.
The message bus registers subscriptions and notifies subscribers when
a matching message is dispatched

@description.name: @description
@description.body: gets the hash map of message subscriptions

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} with registered subscriptions. The key is the message and the value is a map with {subscriber: {Function}, context: {Object|null}}.
@return.description: with registered subscriptions. The key is the message and the value is a map with {subscriber: {Function}, context: {Object|null}}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: subscribes to a message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: message {String} name of message, can be truncated by *
@param.description: name of message, can be truncated by *

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object} The execution context of the callback (i.e. "this")
@param.description: The execution context of the callback (i.e. "this")

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
checks if subscription is already present
if you supply the callback function, match only the exact message monitor
otherwise match all monitors that have the given message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: message {String} Name of message, can be truncated by *
@param.description: Name of message, can be truncated by *

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether monitor is present or not
@return.description: Whether monitor is present or not

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
unsubscribe a listening method
if you supply the callback function and execution context,
remove only this exact subscription
otherwise remove all subscriptions

@param.name: @param
@param.body: message {String} Name of message, can be truncated by *
@param.description: Name of message, can be truncated by *

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether monitor was removed or not
@return.description: Whether monitor was removed or not

@description.name: @description
@description.body: dispatch message and call subscribed functions

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {qx.event.message.Message} message which is being dispatched

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the message was dispatched, false otherwise.
@return.description: true if the message was dispatched, false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Dispatches a new message by supplying the name of the
message and its data.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} Any type of data to attach
@param.description: Any type of data to attach

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the message was dispatched, false otherwise.
@return.description: true if the message was dispatched, false otherwise.

@param.name: @param

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Call subscribers with passed message.

Each currently-subscribed subscriber function will be called in
turn. Any requests to unsubscribe a subscriber from the list, while
processing the currently-subscribed subscriber functions, will take
effect after all currently-subscribed subscriber functions have been
processed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
